div.p: NARRATOR: You'll recall that whenever we drink or use enough drugs to become impaired, the body begins to adapt by increasing our tolerance in an effort to protect us from impairment problems.
NARRATOR: While tolerance is important in each of the three high-risk phases, its effects are most dramatic in the Orange Phase.
NARRATOR: Because in this phase our tolerance becomes high enough to trick us into thinking we are safer when in reality our risk is greater.
